intro: Arenaria qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is adapted to high-altitude environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. Its small, white or pink flowers bloom in the summer months, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to cold and arid conditions.
